alert.note: Alert for Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL SAN JUAN COUNTY THROUGH 530 PM MDT... At 500 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles north of Chaco Canyon, or 34 miles south of Bloomfield, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central San Juan County. This includes Highway 550 near Mile Marker 134. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.
